definition[0]: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc
example[0]: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
definition[1]: a college where students are taught a particular subject or skill
definition[2]: a school in Scotland for children between 11 and 16
definition[3]: a private school in the US
definition[4]: a type of independent secondary school in England that is run with help and money from private organizations or people. Each school specializes in teaching a particular subject such as science, business, or technology.
definition[5]: a type of secondary school in England that is independent, but which is supported by public money. Each Academy has a private sponsor which can either be an individual person or an organization. Although many subjects are taught in an Academy, each school specializes in certain areas such as science, business, computing, or technology.
